thread.title: CHARLIE NICHOLAS: Not many will back Wolves but they could earn a FA Cup replay against Chelsea
thread.title_full: CHARLIE NICHOLAS: Not many will back Wolves but they could earn a FA Cup replay against Chelsea

author: mirror
title: CHARLIE NICHOLAS: Not many will back Wolves but they could earn a FA Cup replay against Chelsea
text:
Wolves stunned Liverpool at Anfield - could they do the same to Chelsea? (Photo: Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
In this week's Sporting Life column, Charlie Nicholas is tipping Wolves to upset the odds again and trouble Premier League leaders Chelsea. 
- - - - - - - - - - 
There are some really interesting potential upsets around in the FA Cup this weekend and I do fancy Tottenham to be pushed hard on Sunday by Fulham. 
My fellow Soccer Saturday panellists Paul Merson and Matt Le Tissier have been down at Sutton 'helping' them train. The two of them were apparently there to give them some tips but that's just made me more confident Arsenal won't have any trouble on Monday night. Charlie Nicholas believes Wolves could spring a surprise against Chelsea 
Not many will be opposing Chelsea in Saturday's late kick-off but I think Wolves could earn a replay at least. 
It's surprising that they have dipped in form since dumping out Liverpool because Paul Lambert isn't one for pats on the backs. Nicholas' Soccer Saturday colleagues Paul Merson (left) and Matt Le Tissier (right) trained with Sutton boss Paul Doswell's side earlier this week (Photo: Getty Images) 
They've lost three successive games since beating Barnsley but you do get the feeling that this Wolves side will relish the upset opportunity. 
It's almost as if it's in Lambert's managerial make-up, having really made his name with that fantastic run in the League Cup as Wycombe manager. 
With no European football, Antonio Conte doesn't need to make too many changes in terms of the schedule but I think he will still make four or five. Chelsea are expected to field a string side against the Championship outfit (Photo: PA) Blues boss Antonio Conte is prepared for a tough test at Molineux (Photo: Darren Walsh) Read More David Luiz takes out Chelsea TV presenter with WWE wrestling move - but pair hug it out 
I'd expect him to rest Diego Costa so he can knock the rust off Michy Batshuayi. David Luiz looks like he's picked up a couple of little injuries so he will likely rest him as well. 
They've obviously got Cesc Fabregas to come in but his other options aren't quite as strong and Eden Hazard hasn't kicked a ball in the competition so far, so it will be interesting to see whether he plays. Paul Lambert will be hoping to mastermind another upset (Photo: Getty) 
Wolves will look to get fiery with Chelsea, which is just what they don't need right now and I've got to stick with them after they came up trumps at 28/1 for me in the previous round.
